segment.source: Adaptive and interactive toast notifications let you create flexible pop-up notifications with more content, optional inline images, and optional user interaction.
segment.target: Adaptive and interactive toast notifications let you create flexible pop-up notifications with more content, optional inline images, and optional user interaction.

segment.source: Adaptive and interactive toast notifications
segment.target: Adaptive and interactive toast notifications

segment.source: Adaptive and interactive toast notifications
segment.target: Adaptive and interactive toast notifications

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Adaptive and interactive toast notifications let you create flexible pop-up notifications with more content, optional inline images, and optional user interaction.
segment.target: Adaptive and interactive toast notifications let you create flexible pop-up notifications with more content, optional inline images, and optional user interaction.

segment.source: The adaptive and interactive toast notifications model has these updates over the legacy toast template catalog:
segment.target: The adaptive and interactive toast notifications model has these updates over the legacy toast template catalog:

segment.source: The option to include buttons and inputs on the notifications.
segment.target: The option to include buttons and inputs on the notifications.

segment.source: Three different activation types for the main toast notification and for each action.
segment.target: Three different activation types for the main toast notification and for each action.

segment.source: The option to create a notification for certain scenarios, including alarms, reminders, and incoming calls.
segment.target: The option to create a notification for certain scenarios, including alarms, reminders, and incoming calls.

segment.source: Note To see the legacy templates from Windows 8.1 and Windows Phone 8.1, see the legacy toast template catalog.
segment.target: Note To see the legacy templates from Windows 8.1 and Windows Phone 8.1, see the legacy toast template catalog.

segment.source: Toast notification structure
segment.target: Toast notification structure

segment.source: Toast notifications are constructed using XML, which would typically contain these key elements:
segment.target: Toast notifications are constructed using XML, which would typically contain these key elements:

segment.source: visual covers the content available for the users to visually see, including text and images
segment.target: visual covers the content available for the users to visually see, including text and images

segment.source: actions contains buttons/inputs the developer wants to add inside the notification
segment.target: actions contains buttons/inputs the developer wants to add inside the notification

segment.source: audio specifies the sound played when the notification pops
segment.target: audio specifies the sound played when the notification pops

segment.source: Here's a code example:
segment.target: Here's a code example:

segment.source: And a visual representation of the structure:
segment.target: And a visual representation of the structure:

segment.source: toast notification structure
segment.target: toast notification structure

segment.source: Visual
segment.target: Visual

segment.source: Inside the visual element, you must have exactly one binding element that contains the visual content of the toast.
segment.target: Inside the visual element, you must have exactly one binding element that contains the visual content of the toast.

segment.source: Tile notifications in Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps support multiple templates that are based on different tile sizes.
segment.target: Tile notifications in Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps support multiple templates that are based on different tile sizes.

segment.source: Toast notifications, however, have only one template name: ToastGeneric.
segment.target: Toast notifications, however, have only one template name: ToastGeneric.

segment.source: Having just the one template name means:
segment.target: Having just the one template name means:

segment.source: You can change the toast content, such as adding another line of text, adding an inline image, or changing the thumbnail image from displaying the app icon to something else, and do any of these things without worrying about changing the entire template or creating an invalid payload due to a mismatch between the template name and the content.
segment.target: You can change the toast content, such as adding another line of text, adding an inline image, or changing the thumbnail image from displaying the app icon to something else, and do any of these things without worrying about changing the entire template or creating an invalid payload due to a mismatch between the template name and the content.

segment.source: You can use the same code to construct the same payload for the toast notification that targets to deliver to different types of Microsoft Windows devices, including phones, tablets, PCs, and Xbox One.
segment.target: You can use the same code to construct the same payload for the toast notification that targets to deliver to different types of Microsoft Windows devices, including phones, tablets, PCs, and Xbox One.

segment.source: Each of these devices will accept the notification and display it to the user under their UI policies with the appropriate visual affordances and interaction model.
segment.target: Each of these devices will accept the notification and display it to the user under their UI policies with the appropriate visual affordances and interaction model.

segment.source: For all attributes supported in the visual section and its child elements, see the Schema section below.
segment.target: For all attributes supported in the visual section and its child elements, see the Schema section below.

segment.source: For more examples, see the XML examples section below.
segment.target: For more examples, see the XML examples section below.

segment.source: Actions
segment.target: Actions

segment.source: In UWP apps, you can add buttons and other inputs to your toast notifications, which lets users do more outside of the app.
segment.target: In UWP apps, you can add buttons and other inputs to your toast notifications, which lets users do more outside of the app.

segment.source: These actions are specified under the actions element, of which there are two types that you can specify:
segment.target: These actions are specified under the actions element, of which there are two types that you can specify:

segment.source: action This appears as a button on desktop and mobile devices.
segment.target: action This appears as a button on desktop and mobile devices.

segment.source: You can specify up to five custom or system actions inside a toast notification.
segment.target: You can specify up to five custom or system actions inside a toast notification.

segment.source: input This allows users to provide input, such as quick replying to a message, or selecting an option from a drop-down menu.
segment.target: input This allows users to provide input, such as quick replying to a message, or selecting an option from a drop-down menu.

segment.source: Both action and input are adaptive within the Windows family of devices.
segment.target: Both action and input are adaptive within the Windows family of devices.

segment.source: For example, on mobile or desktop devices, an action to a user is a button on which to tap/click.
segment.target: For example, on mobile or desktop devices, an action to a user is a button on which to tap/click.

segment.source: A text input is a box in which users can input text using either a physical keyboard or an on-screen keyboard.
segment.target: A text input is a box in which users can input text using either a physical keyboard or an on-screen keyboard.

segment.source: These elements will also adapt to future interaction scenarios, such as an action announced by voice or a text input taken by dictation.
segment.target: These elements will also adapt to future interaction scenarios, such as an action announced by voice or a text input taken by dictation.

segment.source: When an action is taken by the user, you can do one of the following by specifying the ActivationType attribute inside the action element:
segment.target: When an action is taken by the user, you can do one of the following by specifying the ActivationType attribute inside the action element:

segment.source: Activating the app in the foreground, with an action-specific argument that can be used to navigate to a specific page/context.
segment.target: Activating the app in the foreground, with an action-specific argument that can be used to navigate to a specific page/context.

segment.source: Activating the app's background task without affecting the user.
segment.target: Activating the app's background task without affecting the user.

segment.source: Activating another app via protocol launch.
segment.target: Activating another app via protocol launch.

segment.source: Specify a system action to perform.
segment.target: Specify a system action to perform.

segment.source: The current available system actions are snoozing and dismissing scheduled alarm/reminder, which will be further explained in a section below.
segment.target: The current available system actions are snoozing and dismissing scheduled alarm/reminder, which will be further explained in a section below.

segment.source: For all attributes supported in the visual section and its child elements, see the Schema section below.
segment.target: For all attributes supported in the visual section and its child elements, see the Schema section below.

segment.source: For more examples, see the XML examples section below.
segment.target: For more examples, see the XML examples section below.

segment.source: Audio
segment.target: Audio

segment.source: Custom sounds aren't currently supported on UWP apps that target the desktop platform; instead, you can choose from the list of ms-winsoundevents for your app on desktop.
segment.target: Custom sounds aren't currently supported on UWP apps that target the desktop platform; instead, you can choose from the list of ms-winsoundevents for your app on desktop.

segment.source: UWP apps on mobile platforms support both ms-winsoundevents, along with custom sounds in these formats:
segment.target: UWP apps on mobile platforms support both ms-winsoundevents, along with custom sounds in these formats:

segment.source: ms-appx:///
segment.target: ms-appx:///

segment.source: ms-appdata:///
segment.target: ms-appdata:///

segment.source: See the audio schema page for information on audio in toast notifications, which includes a complete list of ms-winsoundevents.
segment.target: See the audio schema page for information on audio in toast notifications, which includes a complete list of ms-winsoundevents.

segment.source: Alarms, reminders, and incoming calls
segment.target: Alarms, reminders, and incoming calls

segment.source: You can use toast notifications for alarms, reminders, and incoming calls.
segment.target: You can use toast notifications for alarms, reminders, and incoming calls.

segment.source: These special toasts have an appearance that's consistent with standard toasts, though special toasts feature some custom, scenario-based UI and patterns:
segment.target: These special toasts have an appearance that's consistent with standard toasts, though special toasts feature some custom, scenario-based UI and patterns:

segment.source: A reminder toast notification will stay on screen until the user dismisses it or takes action.
segment.target: A reminder toast notification will stay on screen until the user dismisses it or takes action.

segment.source: On Windows Mobile, the reminder toast notifications will also show up pre-expanded.
segment.target: On Windows Mobile, the reminder toast notifications will also show up pre-expanded.

segment.source: In addition to sharing the above behaviors with reminder notifications, alarm notifications also automatically play looping audio.
segment.target: In addition to sharing the above behaviors with reminder notifications, alarm notifications also automatically play looping audio.

segment.source: Incoming call notifications are displayed full screen on Windows Mobile devices.
segment.target: Incoming call notifications are displayed full screen on Windows Mobile devices.

segment.source: This is done by specifying the scenario attribute inside the root element of a toast notification – toast: toast scenario=" { default | alarm | reminder | incomingCall } "
segment.target: This is done by specifying the scenario attribute inside the root element of a toast notification – toast: toast scenario=" { default | alarm | reminder | incomingCall } "

segment.source: XML examples
segment.target: XML examples

segment.source: Note The toast notification screenshots for these examples were taken from an app on desktop.
segment.target: Note The toast notification screenshots for these examples were taken from an app on desktop.

segment.source: On mobile devices, a toast notification may be collapsed when it pops up, with a grabber at the bottom of the toast to expand it.
segment.target: On mobile devices, a toast notification may be collapsed when it pops up, with a grabber at the bottom of the toast to expand it.

segment.source: Notification with rich visual contents
segment.target: Notification with rich visual contents

segment.source: This example shows how you can have multiple lines of text, an optional small image to override the application logo, and an optional inline image thumbnail.
segment.target: This example shows how you can have multiple lines of text, an optional small image to override the application logo, and an optional inline image thumbnail.

segment.target: notification with rich visual contents

segment.source: Activation samples
segment.target: Activation samples

segment.source: Like mentioned above, the body and actions in the toast are capable of activating apps in different ways.
segment.target: Like mentioned above, the body and actions in the toast are capable of activating apps in different ways.

segment.source: The below sample will show you how to handle different type of activations from the toast body and/or toast actions.
segment.target: The below sample will show you how to handle different type of activations from the toast body and/or toast actions.

segment.source: Foreground
segment.target: Foreground

segment.source: In this scenario, an app uses foreground activation to respond to an action inside an actionable toast notification by launching the app and navigating to the correct content.
segment.target: In this scenario, an app uses foreground activation to respond to an action inside an actionable toast notification by launching the app and navigating to the correct content.

segment.source: Activation from toast notifications used to invoke OnLaunched().
segment.target: Activation from toast notifications used to invoke OnLaunched().

segment.source: In Windows 10, toast has its own activation kind and will invoke OnActivated().
segment.target: In Windows 10, toast has its own activation kind and will invoke OnActivated().

segment.source: Background
segment.target: Background

segment.source: In this scenario, an app uses a background task to handle an action inside an interactive toast notification.
segment.target: In this scenario, an app uses a background task to handle an action inside an interactive toast notification.

segment.source: The below code shows how to declare this background task for handling toast activations inside your app manifest, and how to get arguments from the action and user inputs when the buttons are clicked.
segment.target: The below code shows how to declare this background task for handling toast activations inside your app manifest, and how to get arguments from the action and user inputs when the buttons are clicked.

segment.source: Schemas: visual and audio
segment.target: Schemas: visual and audio

segment.source: In the following schemas, a "?" suffix means that an attribute is optional.
segment.target: In the following schemas, a "?" suffix means that an attribute is optional.

segment.source: Attributes in toast
segment.target: Attributes in toast

segment.source: launch?
segment.target: launch?

segment.source: launch?
segment.target: launch?

segment.source: = string
segment.target: = string

segment.source: This is an optional attribute.
segment.target: This is an optional attribute.

segment.source: A string that is passed to the application when it is activated by the toast.
segment.target: A string that is passed to the application when it is activated by the toast.

segment.source: Depending on the value of activationType, this value can be received by the app in the foreground, inside the background task, or by another app that's protocol launched from the original app.
segment.target: Depending on the value of activationType, this value can be received by the app in the foreground, inside the background task, or by another app that's protocol launched from the original app.

segment.source: The format and contents of this string are defined by the app for its own use.
segment.target: The format and contents of this string are defined by the app for its own use.

segment.source: When the user taps or clicks the toast to launch its associated app, the launch string provides the context to the app that allows it to show the user a view relevant to the toast content, rather than launching in its default way.
segment.target: When the user taps or clicks the toast to launch its associated app, the launch string provides the context to the app that allows it to show the user a view relevant to the toast content, rather than launching in its default way.

segment.source: If the activation is happened because user clicked on an action, instead of the body of the toast, the developer retrieves back the "arguments" pre-defined in that action tag, instead of "launch" pre-defined in the toast tag.
segment.target: If the activation is happened because user clicked on an action, instead of the body of the toast, the developer retrieves back the "arguments" pre-defined in that action tag, instead of "launch" pre-defined in the toast tag.

segment.source: duration?
segment.target: duration?

segment.source: duration?
segment.target: duration?

segment.source: = "short|long"
segment.target: = "short|long"

segment.source: This is an optional attribute.
segment.target: This is an optional attribute.

segment.source: Default value is "short".
segment.target: Default value is "short".

segment.source: This is only here for specific scenarios and appCompat.
segment.target: This is only here for specific scenarios and appCompat.

segment.source: You don't need this for the alarm scenario anymore.
segment.target: You don't need this for the alarm scenario anymore.

segment.source: We don't recommend using this property.
segment.target: We don't recommend using this property.

segment.source: activationType?
segment.target: activationType?

segment.source: activationType?
segment.target: activationType?

segment.source: = "foreground | background | protocol | system"
segment.target: = "foreground | background | protocol | system"

segment.source: This is an optional attribute.
segment.target: This is an optional attribute.

segment.source: The default value is "foreground".
segment.target: The default value is "foreground".

segment.source: scenario?
segment.target: scenario?

segment.source: scenario?
segment.target: scenario?

segment.source: = "default | alarm | reminder | incomingCall"
segment.target: = "default | alarm | reminder | incomingCall"

segment.source: This is an optional attribute, default value is "default".
segment.target: This is an optional attribute, default value is "default".

segment.source: You do not need this unless your scenario is to pop an alarm, reminder, or incoming call.
segment.target: You do not need this unless your scenario is to pop an alarm, reminder, or incoming call.

segment.source: Do not use this just for keeping your notification persistent on screen.
segment.target: Do not use this just for keeping your notification persistent on screen.

segment.source: Attributes in visual
segment.target: Attributes in visual

segment.source: version?
segment.target: version?

segment.source: version?
segment.target: version?

segment.source: = nonNegativeInteger
segment.target: = nonNegativeInteger

segment.source: This attribute isn't necessary because versioning will be deprecated on visual.
segment.target: This attribute isn't necessary because versioning will be deprecated on visual.

segment.source: Stay tuned for a new versioning model that you'll specify from a higher hierarchy, if needed.
segment.target: Stay tuned for a new versioning model that you'll specify from a higher hierarchy, if needed.

segment.target: lang?

segment.source: template?
segment.target: template?

segment.source: \[Important\] template?
segment.target: \[Important\] template?

segment.source: = "ToastGeneric"
segment.target: = "ToastGeneric"

segment.source: If you are using any of the new adaptive and interactive notification features, please make sure you start using "ToastGeneric" template instead of the legacy template.
segment.target: If you are using any of the new adaptive and interactive notification features, please make sure you start using "ToastGeneric" template instead of the legacy template.

segment.source: Using the legacy templates with the new actions might work now, but that is not the intended use case, and we cannot guarantee that will continue working.
segment.target: Using the legacy templates with the new actions might work now, but that is not the intended use case, and we cannot guarantee that will continue working.

segment.target: Attributes in text

segment.target: lang?

segment.target: See this element schema article for details on this optional attribute.

segment.target: src

segment.source: placement?
segment.target: placement?

segment.source: placement?
segment.target: placement?

segment.source: = "inline" | "appLogoOverride"
segment.target: = "inline" | "appLogoOverride"

segment.source: This attribute is optional.
segment.target: This attribute is optional.

segment.source: This specifies where this image will be displayed.
segment.target: This specifies where this image will be displayed.

segment.source: "inline" means inside the toast body, below the text; "appLogoOverride" means replace the application icon (that shows up on the top left corner of the toast).
segment.target: "inline" means inside the toast body, below the text; "appLogoOverride" means replace the application icon (that shows up on the top left corner of the toast).

segment.source: You can have up to one image for each placement value.
segment.target: You can have up to one image for each placement value.

segment.source: alt?
segment.target: alt?

segment.source: See this element schema article for details on this optional attribute.
segment.target: See this element schema article for details on this optional attribute.

segment.source: addImageQuery?
segment.target: addImageQuery?

segment.source: See this element schema article for details on this optional attribute.
segment.target: See this element schema article for details on this optional attribute.

segment.source: hint-crop?
segment.target: hint-crop?

segment.source: hint-crop?
segment.target: hint-crop?

segment.source: = "none" | "circle"
segment.target: = "none" | "circle"

segment.source: This attribute is optional.
segment.target: This attribute is optional.

segment.source: "none" is the default value which means no cropping.
segment.target: "none" is the default value which means no cropping.

segment.source: "circle" crops the image to a circular shape.
segment.target: "circle" crops the image to a circular shape.

segment.source: Use this for profile images of a contact, images of a person, and so on.
segment.target: Use this for profile images of a contact, images of a person, and so on.

segment.target: Attributes in audio

segment.target: loop?

segment.target: silent?

segment.target: See this element schema article for details on this optional attribute.

segment.source: Schemas: action
segment.target: Schemas: action

segment.source: In the following schemas, a "?" suffix means that an attribute is optional.
segment.target: In the following schemas, a "?" suffix means that an attribute is optional.

segment.source: Attributes in input
segment.target: Attributes in input

segment.source: id
segment.target: id

segment.source: id = string
segment.target: id = string

segment.source: This attribute is required.
segment.target: This attribute is required.

segment.source: The id attribute is required and is used by developers to retrieve user inputs once the app is activated (in the foreground or background).
segment.target: The id attribute is required and is used by developers to retrieve user inputs once the app is activated (in the foreground or background).

segment.source: type
segment.target: type

segment.source: type = "text | selection"
segment.target: type = "text | selection"

segment.source: This attribute is required.
segment.target: This attribute is required.

segment.source: It is used to specify a text input or input from a list of pre-defined selections.
segment.target: It is used to specify a text input or input from a list of pre-defined selections.

segment.source: On mobile and desktop, this is to specify whether you want a textbox input or a listbox input.
segment.target: On mobile and desktop, this is to specify whether you want a textbox input or a listbox input.

segment.source: title?
segment.target: title?

segment.source: title?
segment.target: title?

segment.source: = string
segment.target: = string

segment.source: The title attribute is optional and is for developers to specify a title for the input for shells to render when there is affordance.
segment.target: The title attribute is optional and is for developers to specify a title for the input for shells to render when there is affordance.

segment.source: For mobile and desktop, this title will be displayed above the input.
segment.target: For mobile and desktop, this title will be displayed above the input.

segment.source: placeHolderContent?
segment.target: placeHolderContent?

segment.source: placeHolderContent?
segment.target: placeHolderContent?

segment.source: = string
segment.target: = string

segment.source: The placeHolderContent attribute is optional and is the grey-out hint text for text input type.
segment.target: The placeHolderContent attribute is optional and is the grey-out hint text for text input type.

segment.source: This attribute is ignored when the input type is not "text".
segment.target: This attribute is ignored when the input type is not "text".

segment.source: defaultInput?
segment.target: defaultInput?

segment.source: defaultInput?
segment.target: defaultInput?

segment.source: = string
segment.target: = string

segment.source: The defaultInput attribute is optional and is used to provide a default input value.
segment.target: The defaultInput attribute is optional and is used to provide a default input value.

segment.source: If the input type is "text", this will be treated as a string input.
segment.target: If the input type is "text", this will be treated as a string input.

segment.source: If the input type is "selection", this is expected to be the id of one of the available selections inside this input's elements.
segment.target: If the input type is "selection", this is expected to be the id of one of the available selections inside this input's elements.

segment.source: Attributes in selection
segment.target: Attributes in selection

segment.source: id
segment.target: id

segment.source: This attribute is required.
segment.target: This attribute is required.

segment.source: It's used to identify user selections.
segment.target: It's used to identify user selections.

segment.source: The id is returned to your app.
segment.target: The id is returned to your app.

segment.source: content
segment.target: content

segment.source: This attribute is required.
segment.target: This attribute is required.

segment.source: It provides the string to display for this selection element.
segment.target: It provides the string to display for this selection element.

segment.source: Attributes in action
segment.target: Attributes in action

segment.source: content
segment.target: content

segment.source: content = string
segment.target: content = string

segment.source: The content attribute is required.
segment.target: The content attribute is required.

segment.source: It provides the text string displayed on the button.
segment.target: It provides the text string displayed on the button.

segment.source: arguments
segment.target: arguments

segment.source: arguments = string
segment.target: arguments = string

segment.source: The arguments attribute it required.
segment.target: The arguments attribute it required.

segment.source: It describes the app-defined data that the app can later retrieve once it is activated from user taking this action.
segment.target: It describes the app-defined data that the app can later retrieve once it is activated from user taking this action.

segment.source: activationType?
segment.target: activationType?

segment.source: activationType?
segment.target: activationType?

segment.source: = "foreground | background | protocol | system"
segment.target: = "foreground | background | protocol | system"

segment.source: The activationType attribute is optional and its default value is "foreground".
segment.target: The activationType attribute is optional and its default value is "foreground".

segment.source: It describes the kind of activation this action will cause: foreground, background, or launching another app via protocol launch, or invoking a system action.
segment.target: It describes the kind of activation this action will cause: foreground, background, or launching another app via protocol launch, or invoking a system action.

segment.source: imageUri?
segment.target: imageUri?

segment.source: imageUri?
segment.target: imageUri?

segment.source: = string
segment.target: = string

segment.source: imageUri is optional and is used to provide an image icon for this action to display inside the button alone with the text content.
segment.target: imageUri is optional and is used to provide an image icon for this action to display inside the button alone with the text content.

segment.source: hint-inputId
segment.target: hint-inputId

segment.source: hint-inputId = string
segment.target: hint-inputId = string

segment.source: The hint-inpudId attribute is required.
segment.target: The hint-inpudId attribute is required.

segment.source: It's specifically used for the quick reply scenario.
segment.target: It's specifically used for the quick reply scenario.

segment.source: The value needs to be the id of the input element desired to be associated with.
segment.target: The value needs to be the id of the input element desired to be associated with.

segment.source: In mobile and desktop, this will put the button right next to the input box.
segment.target: In mobile and desktop, this will put the button right next to the input box.

segment.source: Attributes for system-handled actions
segment.target: Attributes for system-handled actions

segment.source: The system can handle actions for snoozing and dismissing notifications if you don't want your app to handle the snoozing/rescheduling of notifications as a background task.
segment.target: The system can handle actions for snoozing and dismissing notifications if you don't want your app to handle the snoozing/rescheduling of notifications as a background task.

segment.source: System-handled actions can be combined (or individually specified), but we don't recommend implementing a snooze action without a dismiss action.
segment.target: System-handled actions can be combined (or individually specified), but we don't recommend implementing a snooze action without a dismiss action.

segment.source: System commands combo: SnoozeAndDismiss
segment.target: System commands combo: SnoozeAndDismiss

segment.source: Individual system-handled actions
segment.target: Individual system-handled actions

segment.source: To construct individual snooze and dismiss actions, do the following:
segment.target: To construct individual snooze and dismiss actions, do the following:

segment.source: Specify activationType = "system"
segment.target: Specify activationType = "system"

segment.source: Specify arguments = "snooze" | "dismiss"
segment.target: Specify arguments = "snooze" | "dismiss"

segment.source: Specify content:
segment.target: Specify content:

segment.source: If you want localized strings of "snooze" and "dismiss" to be displayed on the actions, specify content to be an empty string: action content = ""/
segment.target: If you want localized strings of "snooze" and "dismiss" to be displayed on the actions, specify content to be an empty string: action content = ""/

segment.source: If you want a customized string, just provide its value: action content="Remind me later" /
segment.target: If you want a customized string, just provide its value: action content="Remind me later" /

segment.source: Specify input:
segment.target: Specify input:

segment.source: If you don't want the user to select a snooze interval and instead just want your notification to snooze only once for a system-defined time interval (that is consistent across the OS), then don't construct any input at all.
segment.target: If you don't want the user to select a snooze interval and instead just want your notification to snooze only once for a system-defined time interval (that is consistent across the OS), then don't construct any input at all.

segment.source: If you want to provide snooze interval selections:
segment.target: If you want to provide snooze interval selections:

segment.source: Specify hint-inputId in the snooze action
segment.target: Specify hint-inputId in the snooze action

segment.source: Match the id of the input with the hint-inputId of the snooze action: input id="snoozeTime"/inputaction hint-inputId="snoozeTime"/
segment.target: Match the id of the input with the hint-inputId of the snooze action: input id="snoozeTime"/inputaction hint-inputId="snoozeTime"/

segment.source: Specify selection id to be a nonNegativeInteger which represents snooze interval in minutes: selection id="240" / means snoozing for 4 hours
segment.target: Specify selection id to be a nonNegativeInteger which represents snooze interval in minutes: selection id="240" / means snoozing for 4 hours

segment.source: Make sure that the value of defaultInput in input matches with one of the ids of the selection children elements
segment.target: Make sure that the value of defaultInput in input matches with one of the ids of the selection children elements

segment.source: Provide up to (but no more than) 5 selection values
segment.target: Provide up to (but no more than) 5 selection values
